oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Kris Kristofferson interview - Ralph Emery - Part 1 - 1980-02-26
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of an interview with Kris Kristofferson conducted by Ralph Emery on February 26, 1980.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Kris Kristofferson; Ralph Emery;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Ralph Emery talks (incomplete) -- Kris Kristofferson introduces himself and says how he has trouble pronouncing his own name -- Ralph Emery introduces his show and Kristofferson -- Kris Kristofferson talks about doing a Hank Williams tribute show with Brenda Lee, Waylon Jennings, and more -- Kris Kristofferson talks about his first time hearing Hank Williams and how big of a fan he is -- Kristofferson talks about how he can't yodel -- Kristofferson talks about how the song "Me And Bobby McGee" got its name -- Kristofferson talks about imposters claiming to be Bobby McGee -- Kristofferson talks about working as a helicopter pilot -- Kristofferson talks about "Busted Flat In Baton Rouge" -- Kristofferson talks about working with Barbara Streisand on set -- Emery asks about Kristofferson's 1980 movie plans -- Kristofferson talks about a new movie "Heaven's Gate" and the character he plays -- Ralph Emery asks about "Help Me Make It Through The Night" and an old Sinatra quote -- Kristofferson says how he based the name of the song on the Sinatra quote -- Emery talks about the songs original recording -- Kristofferson talks about who first recorded the song (Bill Nash) and how much he liked it -- Kristofferson talks about Waylon Jennings and Ray Price fighting over who would cut the song -- Emery remembers Johnny Cash claiming to cut the song, but never did -- Kristofferson talks about Waylon's music listening habits and recording "The Taker" -- Kristofferson talks about his home in Malibu and his daughter Casey -- Kristofferson talks about touring with Willie Nelson and that he will be taking the next month off before working on the movie -- Emery asks about Rita Coolidge and if they will make it -- Kristofferson says they are getting a divorce but will remain mature about it for Casey's sake -- Kristofferson talks about meeting Rita Coolidge in 1971 on an airplane headed to Nashville -- Emery talks about Coolidge being a native of Nashville -- Kristofferson has a loss for words talking about his wife -- Emery brings the conversation back to music and notes that an edit will be made at this point in the interview -- Emery asks about when Kristofferson first arrived in Nashville and his first job cleaning ashtrays at Columbia Records and that's how he met Johnny Cash -- Kristofferson says how it was the perfect job for a songwriter because the work was easy and he got to meet various artists -- Emery talks about how this job was a step down from the military and being a Rhodes Scholar -- Kristofferson talks about how he was so focused on songwriting at the time -- Kristofferson talks about his parents point of view on his initial music career -- Kristofferson talks about his father's career and how his father asked for Kris' forgiveness for questioning his music career -- Kristofferson talks about turning down Westpoint -- Kristofferson talks about the image of people who lived in Nashville at the start of his career -- Kristofferson talks about his mothers love of country music -- Kristofferson talks about where he was raised in Texas and going to college in California at Pimona College -- Kristofferson talks about being a Rhodes Scholar in college -- Kristofferson talks about playing football and boxing -- Kristofferson talks about being in Time Magazine knocking a guy out in Golden Gloves -- Emery asks about Kris' transition from college to the army -- Kristofferson explains how he was in ROTC in college then transitioned to the army in 1961 -- Kristofferson says he was turned down to go to Vietnam and also rejected Westpoint -- Kristofferson talks about how he had a band while in Germany and one of the guys in the band was related to Marijohn Wilkin and they sent her some tapes -- Kristofferson got a letter for Marijohn Wilkins saying she wanted him to come write for them -- Kristofferson tells the story about flying a helicopter to Johnny Cash's house to show him a song "Sunday Morning Coming Down" -- Emery talks about where they are having this interview -- Kristofferson talks about how he used to live across the street in an apartment -- Kristofferson talks about writing "Sunday Morning Coming Down" in that apartment and what inspired the song -- Kristofferson talks about bartending at the Tallyho Tavern and during this time his wife got pregnant -- Kristofferson talks about flying helicopters in the Gulf of Mexico -- Kristofferson talks about leaving Nashville and how Fred Foster and Bob Becker financed him for some time and how he gave Roger Miller a song others wanted Kris to record -- Kristofferson talks about making records rather than songwriting alone -- Kristofferson talks about always either working on a movie or on the road -- Emery talks about Kris' marriages and separations -- Kristofferson talks about the music scene in Nashville when we was there -- Emery talks about losing a song because he didn't get back to Marijohn Wilkin fast enough -- Kristofferson talks about "Jody And The Kid" and Willie Nelson's tribute to him and how it helped him as being remembered as a songwriter rather than an actor -- Kristofferson describes a typical year for him: doing concerts, doing a film, and going on the road -- Kristofferson talks about quitting drinking and how crazy it is to him to be in Nashville again -- Kristofferson talks about playing Billy the Kid in a movie -- Emery talks about how Kris has done a little bit of everything in his life -- Kristofferson talks about doing the movie "Semi Tough" how all the injuries he sustained during the movie -- Kristofferson tells a funny story from the making of "A Star Is Born" where he swings Barbara Streisand around and her legs knock a bunch of glasses off the piano, knocked a bunch of lights over, and dropped Barbara -- Kristofferson talks about how Barbara Streisand was such a good sport on set but does not conceal her feelings -- Kristofferson talks about working on "The Sailor Who Fell From Grace From The Sea" -- Kristofferson talks about how he would like to make a movie with Jane Fonda, Diane Cannon, Michael Chevino, Willie Nelson, and others -- Kristofferson talks about doing a new film with Willie Nelson and other movies with Willie -- Kristofferson talks about handling mobs and fans -- Kristofferson talks about working with Muhammad Ali -- Kristofferson talks about recording with Ernest Tubb last night and how he is a fan of Tubb -- Kristofferson talks about how the first time he was on television was on Emery's show -- Emery talks about how much the girls used to love Kristofferson -- Kristofferson talks (incomplete)
